author: dgeary
msg: This commit integrates Shale with Apache Commons Validator. The following were added to Shale:
1. A JSF validator that represents a Commons validator. (CommonsValidator)
2. A JSP tag (s:commonsValidator) that represents the validator. (CommonsValidatorTag)
3. A JSF component that generates JavaScript validation according to validators in the page. (ValidatorScript)
4. A JSP tag (s:validatorScript) that represents the component. (ValidatorScriptTag)
5. A utility class for implementing JSP tags that represent JSF components. (Tags)
To use Commons validators in your Shale application, you must have version 1.1.4 or later
of Apache Commons Validator and follow these steps:
a. Add commons-validators.jar to your WAR file.
b. Add validator-rules.xml to WEB-INF. (You can find a copy in use-cases/src/web/WEB-INF)
c. Add an onsubmit attribute to your h:form tag that calls your validation function
d. Add validators, with s:commonsValidator, to your input components
e. Add an s:validatorScript tag just before you close off your form. That tag must have a functionName attribute that corresponds to the function name from step a.
See the use-cases application for an example of client- and server-side validation.
